Overview.Summary: The 2021 Kosovan presidential election was held on April 3-4, with Vjosa Osmani winning with 71 votes (1). Three political parties boycotted the vote (1). Previous president Hashim Thaci resigned in 2020 to face war crimes charges (2). The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) sent an election observation mission to the 2021 presidential election (3). The 2021 inauguration day for US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris also received news coverage (4). The New York Times reported on the results of the 2020 presidential election, which saw Joseph R. Biden Jr. elected as the 46th President of the United States (5). The OeAD Scholars & Alumni Facebook page shared information about HERAS+ fellowships for Kosovan citizens (6). A president in Europe resigned in November 2020 to face trial for war crimes committed more than 20 years ago (7). Kosovo held a snap election on February 14, 2021 (8). In January 2021, Bobi Wine ran against Yoweri Museveni in the Ugandan presidential election (9). Museveni was declared the winner amid allegations of fraud (10).

Timeline.Text: The parliament of Kosovo holds indirect elections for president of Kosovo. Vjosa Osmani wins with 71 votes.
Kosovo prepares for snap elections.
Reggae star Bobi Wine runs for president in Uganda.
Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni wins re-election despite allegations of fraud.
Joe Biden is inaugurated as the 46th president of the United States.
Applications for HERAS+ Fellowships for Kosovan citizens close.
Kosovo President Hashim Thaci resigns after being indicted for war crimes.
A president in Europe resigns to face trial for atrocity crimes committed more than 20 years ago.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. is elected as the 46th president of the United States.
The OSCE deploys an Election Observation Mission (EOM) to the 24 October 2021 presidential election in Uzbekistan.

Overview.Summary: The 2021 Kosovan presidential election will take place on October 24, 2021 (1). An international observation mission has been deployed to monitor the election (1). The election will determine the country's new president and vice-president (2). The current president of Kosovo and the president of Serbia have come to an agreement on the KFOR mission in the country (3). The election is expected to be a close race between incumbent Yoweri Museveni and opposition candidate Bobi Wine (4,6,9). However, the anti-establishment party Vetevendosje is currently leading in preliminary results (7). The election is also significant for the country's future, as it will shape the political landscape and potentially bring change to the government (5,6). Additionally, there are opportunities for Kosovan citizens in the fields of postgraduate, PhD, and postdoctoral studies (8). In other news, Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed a law allowing him to run for two more terms as president, potentially extending his rule until 2036 (10).

Timeline.Text: Bobi Wine takes on Yoweri Museveni in the Ugandan presidential election.
Vetevendosje is set to win the Kosovan parliamentary election with 46.8% of the votes.
Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte claims victory and a fourth term in the parliamentary election.
Russian President Vladimir Putin signs a law allowing him to run for two more terms.

Overview.Summary: The 2021 Kosovan presidential election (10) saw the election of Vjosa Osmani-Sadriu as president of the Republic of Kosovo (1). The election was held on February 14 (7) and resulted in a landslide win for left-wing reformist Albin Kurti (10). The president has accused Russia of destabilizing the Balkans (1) and has pledged to reframe talks with Serbia (10).

Kosovo and Israel establish diplomatic ties.
Kosovo citizens head to the polls to elect a new government in snap elections.

The election results were not considered final until all votes were counted and certified (8).

Mohamed Bazoum is declared the winner of Niger's presidential election.
The results of the 2017 Kosovan parliamentary election are displayed on a map.
The official results of the 2021 Kosovan presidential election are not yet final.
Maia Sandu is declared the winner of Moldova's presidential election, becoming the country's first female leader.
The results of four past presidential elections were contested.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. is elected the 46th president of the United States, while the New York Times reports on the results of the New York presidential race.
The election observation mission for the 24 October 2021 Kosovan presidential election is deployed by the OSCE.
The original method of electing the president and vice president of the United States is explained in Article II, Section 1, of the Constitution.

Overview.Summary: On December 4, 2021, voters in The Gambia (1) reelected incumbent President Adama Barrow in the country's first presidential poll since 2016 (1). Joseph R. Biden Jr. was elected the 46th president of the United States on November 3, 2020 (2). The United States will hold a presidential election on November 5, 2024 (4). The 24 October 2021 presidential election in Uzbekistan was observed by the OSCE (5). In Ivory Coast, President Alassane Ouattara won a controversial third term in office in an election boycotted by the opposition (6). On January 14, 2021, Uganda was counting votes after a tense presidential election (7). President Yoweri Museveni won a sixth five-year term, but his top challenger dismissed the "cooked-up, fraudulent results" on January 16, 2021 (8,9). In the US, President Trump claimed the election result could end up in the US Supreme Court (10).

Timeline.Text: Joseph R. Biden Jr. is elected the 46th president of the United States.
The United States prepares for the 60th presidential election in its history, the first to be held after the 2020 redistricting cycle.
A mob loyal to President Trump storms the Capitol, disrupting the electoral vote counting process.
Uganda begins counting votes for its presidential election.
Uganda's President Yoweri Museveni wins a sixth term, despite allegations of fraud from his opponent.
Adama Barrow is re-elected as President of The Gambia, marking the country's first presidential poll since 2016.
The Republic of Uzbekistan holds its presidential election, with an OSCE Election Observation Mission in place.
The United States holds its 60th presidential election, with the winner being sworn into office on January 20, 2025.

100.Title: Vjosa Osmani elected new president of Kosovo - Kosovo 2.0
100.Snippet: Vjosa Osmani has been elected as the new president of Kosovo, after securing a majority of votes from deputies in the Assembly. The former acting president, who secured more personal votes than any other candidate in Kosovo’s history in the recent general election, becomes Kosovo’s fifth president since declaring independence in 2008. . She will have a five year manda

Overview.Summary: Vjosa Osmani was elected as the second female president of Kosovo (1,5,7,8,10). She is a law professor and is known for her feminist and progressive views (8,10). Osmani has identified fighting against corruption, unemployment, and the COVID-19 pandemic as her top priorities (8). She was elected by indirect suffrage by the parliament (7). Osmani has also accused Russia of destabilizing the Balkans (2) and has called for early parliamentary elections (3). Her predecessor was Atifete Jahjaga (1).

Timeline.Text: Vjosa Osmani is elected as the new president of Kosovo.
Vjosa Osmani becomes the second female president of Kosovo, following Atifete Jahjaga.
Vjosa Osmani outlines her priorities as president, including tackling COVID-19, corruption, and unemployment.
Vjosa Osmani claims that former Serbian President Boris Tadić was killed in Serbia, sparking controversy and a response from the Serbian government.
Vjosa Osmani accuses Russia of destabilizing the Balkans.
Vjosa Osmani dissolves the Kosovo assembly and calls for early parliamentary elections.
The OSCE deploys an Election Observation Mission for the 2024 presidential election in Kosovo.
The 2024 presidential election takes place in Kosovo.

Overview.Summary: Vjosa Osmani was elected as the first female president of Kosovo (1, 6). The election took place in April 2021 (1, 6) and was observed by the OSCE (2). This election marks the first time since 2016 that Kosovo has held a presidential election (4). The election was also notable for the participation of multiple female candidates (6). In the past, Kosovo has had a female president, Atifete Jahjaga, who served from 2011 to 2016 (1). This election was also significant due to the involvement of former reggae star Bobi Wine as a candidate (10). There were concerns about potential fraud in the election (13, 19), but the results were ultimately accepted (19). The election was held amid ongoing tensions with Serbia (7).

Timeline.Text: Bobi Wine, a popular musician and politician, challenges incumbent Yoweri Museveni in Uganda's presidential election.
Museveni is declared the winner of the Ugandan presidential election, despite allegations of fraud.
The anti-establishment party Vetevendosje wins a majority in Kosovo's parliamentary election.
Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte claims victory in the country's election and secures a fourth term.
Kosovo holds indirect elections for president, with three rounds of voting before Vjosa Osmani is declared the winner.
Russian President Vladimir Putin signs a law allowing him to run for two more terms in office.
Patrice Talon is re-elected as president of Benin with 86% of the vote.
Vjosa Osmani is officially elected as the second female president of Kosovo.
